text: right now as we speak there are people
in northern Uganda tagging pictures of
Rihanna and Andy Murray and other
celebrities inside low-cost computer
centers that we've helped to set up I'm
Lila Jonna and I'm the founder and CEO
of the sama group and we connect
low-income people to work over the
Internet
sama means equal in Sanskrit and it's a
core part of my moral philosophy so many
people around the world are poor not
because they're not willing to work hard
or because they don't have the skill or
the will but simply because they're cut
off from economic opportunity now thanks
to the decreasing cost of Technology and
the increased access around the world
there are ways to connect even the
poorest people to the Internet and we
call our model the micro work model our
model involves taking big digital
projects and breaking them down into
small units of work and through that
model we're able to train people much
more quickly to do small tasks rather
than big outsourcing projects so for
example we work with Getty Images to
outsource image tagging of celebrities
to very low income people in northern
Uganda some of whom are former child
soldiers
we're 51 percent female across our
workforce which is a real milestone
because typically technology jobs and
low-income
economies are done by men and not women
I've seen people in rural Kenya pick up
micro work faster than my father could
so I waited until our international
programs were going strong and then I
thought okay the time is ripe for doing
something local in our country there's a
70% dropout rate among students in
Community College and the primary reason
that students drop out is that they lack
income to support their families or to
be able to afford going to college and
so our idea was what if we could use
online work as a way for those students
to supplement their income so that they
could graduate from school so we teach
them how to set up a website for a local
business using WordPress which is a
popular blogging application we teach
them how to do very basic content
writing for local blogs and make them
digitally literate in the future
marketplace for work I would actually
suggest writing a proposal for it
we found that with an 80 hour bootcamp
we were able to increase students
incomes by 20% so I do this work because
I think we're all part of the same human
family and I feel like it's a crime
that's roughly half of humanity lives in
avoidable suffering lives in poverty and
and we needn't live in a world like that
